hints.content:
We know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

There are $\blueD{7}$ days.

And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

A candy factory makes $\purpleC4$ pieces of candy each day.

The product will tell us the $\greenD{\text{total}}$.

In this problem, the $\greenD{\text{total}}$ is the $\greenD{\text{total pieces of candy}}$.
The product tells us the $\greenD{\text{total pieces of candy}}$.

question.content:
A candy factory makes $4$ pieces of candy each day for $7$ days.

**What does the expression $7\times4$ represent?**
